pullRequest.title: Delete index API properly handles backing indices for data streams
pullRequest.bodyText:
The delete index API now handles backing indices for data streams. Specifically:

If an index is the current write index for a data stream, it will reject the deletion request.
If an index is a backing index but not the current write index for a data stream, the index will be deleted and the index will be removed from the parent data stream's list of backing indices.

Relates to #53100

nodes.bodyText: maybe also verify that the data stream is updated by checking the get data streams api and verify that there is only one backing index?

nodes.bodyText: nit: use assertThat(...) with isNull() as matcher instead? I think in general that is the preferred way of writing test assertions.

maybe also assert that the index that is supposed to be removed really is removed? I think we now just check that all other indices but the removed index exists. I think that for that, just checking that the number of backing indices is decremented by 1 should suffice.
I think that instead of looping here just checking that the index that is supposed to be removed is removed and checking that the number of indices is decremented by one is sufficient.
Would be good to assert that backingIndices.size() == indices.size() - 1?
